javadoc:
Provides for the creation and management of a named lock file. Keep in mind
 that if a lock expires it may be removed without notice.  Care should be
 taken to renew a lock file in a timely manner.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: name
params.comment: unmangled name of entity which this lock is associated with.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: name
params.comment: unmangled name of entity which this lock is associated with.

params.name: lockType
params.comment: unique lock identifier (may not contain a '.')

methods.javadoc:
Constructor.
@param file file whose lock state will be controlled with this lock file.
methods.name: <init>

params.name: file
params.comment: file whose lock state will be controlled with this lock file.

methods.name: hasAnyLock

params.name: mangledName
params.comment: mangled name of file or entity which this lock is associated with.

return.comment: true if any lock exists within dir for the given entity name.

methods.name: isLocked

params.name: name
params.comment: of entity which this lock is associated with.

return.comment: true if any lock exists within dir for the given entity name.

methods.javadoc:
@param file file whose lock state is controlled with this lock file.
@return true if any lock exists within dir for the given entity name.
methods.name: isLocked

params.name: file
params.comment: file whose lock state is controlled with this lock file.

return.comment: true if any lock exists within dir for the given entity name.

methods.javadoc:
Determine if lock file was successfully created by this instance.
 This does not quarentee that the lock is still present if more
 than MAX_LOCK_LEASE_PERIOD has lapsed since lock was created.
@return true if lock has been created, otherwise false.
methods.name: haveLock
methods.comment:
Determine if lock file was successfully created by this instance.
 This does not quarentee that the lock is still present if more
 than MAX_LOCK_LEASE_PERIOD has lapsed since lock was created.

return.comment: true if lock has been created, otherwise false.

methods.javadoc:
Determine if lock is still in place.
 Verifying the lock may be necessary when slow processes are holding 
 the lock without timely renewals.
@return true if lock is still in place, otherwise false.
methods.name: haveLock
methods.comment:
Determine if lock is still in place.
 Verifying the lock may be necessary when slow processes are holding 
 the lock without timely renewals.

return.comment: true if lock is still in place, otherwise false.

methods.name: renewLock
methods.comment:
Renew the lease on a lock.
 This is accomplished by changing its last modification time.

return.comment: true if lock extension granted, else false.

methods.javadoc:
Return the name of the current lock owner
 or "<Unknown>" if not locked or could not be determined.
methods.name: getLockOwner
methods.comment:
Return the name of the current lock owner
 or "" if not locked or could not be determined.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the lock file.
 This method should be invoked when the corresponding transaction is complete.
methods.name: removeLock
methods.comment:
Remove the lock file.
 This method should be invoked when the corresponding transaction is complete.

methods.name: createLock
methods.comment:
Create the lock file using the default timeout.
 Lock is guaranteed for MAX_LOCK_LEASE_PERIOD seconds.

return.comment: true if lock creation was successful.

methods.name: createLock
methods.comment:
Create the lock file.
 If another lock file already exists, wait for it to expire
 within the specified timeout period.  Method will block
 until either the lock is obtained or the timeout period lapses.

params.name: timeout
params.comment: maximum time in milliseconds to wait for lock.

params.name: hold
params.comment:
if true the lock will be held and maintained until
 removed, otherwise it is only guaranteed for MAX_LOCK_LEASE_PERIOD seconds.

return.comment: true if lock creation was successful.

methods.name: createLockFileNoWait
methods.comment: Attempt once to create a lock file.

params.name: testLock
params.comment: if true an expiration check will be performed on the lock

return.comment: true if the lock file successfully created, else false.

methods.javadoc:
Start the wait task if it is not already running.
 Set the create flag within the wait task.
@param create an attempt to create a lock file will be done if true, 
 otherwise only attempt to remove stale lock file.
methods.name: startWaitTimer
methods.comment:
Start the wait task if it is not already running.
 Set the create flag within the wait task.

params.name: create
params.comment:
an attempt to create a lock file will be done if true, 
 otherwise only attempt to remove stale lock file.

methods.javadoc:
Initiate lock hold.
 Lock will continue to be renewed until holdLockThread is interrupted.
methods.name: holdLock
methods.comment:
Initiate lock hold.
 Lock will continue to be renewed until holdLockThread is interrupted.

methods.javadoc:
Cleanup lock resources and tasks.
 Invoking this method could prevent stale locks from being removed
 if createLock was invoked with a very short timeout.
 Use of dispose is optional - the associated wait task should 
 stop by it self allowing the LockFile object to be finalized.
methods.name: dispose
methods.comment:
Cleanup lock resources and tasks.
 Invoking this method could prevent stale locks from being removed
 if createLock was invoked with a very short timeout.
 Use of dispose is optional - the associated wait task should 
 stop by it self allowing the LockFile object to be finalized.

name: LockFile
comment:
Provides for the creation and management of a named lock file. Keep in mind
 that if a lock expires it may be removed without notice.  Care should be
 taken to renew a lock file in a timely manner.

fields.javadoc:
The maximum lock lease period in seconds.  To retain a 
 lock longer than this period of time, the renewLock() method must be 
 invoked before the lock expires.  This is the amount of time a user will have to 
 wait for a stuck lock to be removed.
fields.name: DEFAULT_MAX_LOCK_LEASE_PERIOD_MS
fields.comment:
The maximum lock lease period in seconds.  To retain a 
 lock longer than this period of time, the renewLock() method must be 
 invoked before the lock expires.  This is the amount of time a user will have to 
 wait for a stuck lock to be removed.

fields.javadoc: The default timeout for obtaining a lock.
fields.name: DEFAULT_TIMEOUT_MS
fields.comment: The default timeout for obtaining a lock.
